sections.heading: Documentation essentials
sections.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Specimen & labs
sections.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
sections.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Documentation essentials
sections.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Specimen & labs
sections.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Neuro checks pathway
sections.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Reporting expectations
sections.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
sections.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Documentation essentials
sections.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Infection control actions
sections.text: Implement appropriate precautions, ensure hand hygiene/PPE, and notify IP per facility process. Consider cohorting during outbreaks. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
sections.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Reporting expectations
sections.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
sections.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Monitoring after change
sections.text: Increase monitoring frequency based on clinical presentation and provider orders; document trends and escalation criteria. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Specimen & labs
sections.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Notifications & reporting
sections.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Communicable disease control
sections.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Documentation essentials
sections.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Fever evaluation
sections.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Neuro checks pathway
sections.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Reporting expectations
sections.text: Follow facility and regulatory reporting requirements for allegations, incidents, and significant changes. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
sections.text: Use Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated. Post signage and ensure staff education. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
sections.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Specimen & labs
sections.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Notifications & reporting
sections.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Respiratory hygiene
sections.text: Encourage source control, cough etiquette, and masking during respiratory illness as indicated. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Communicable disease control
sections.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Notifications & reporting
sections.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Care planning
sections.text: Identify and address risks through individualized interventions and care plan updates; document implementation. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Communicable disease control
sections.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
sections.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Infection control actions
sections.text: Implement appropriate precautions, ensure hand hygiene/PPE, and notify IP per facility process. Consider cohorting during outbreaks. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Notifications & reporting
sections.text: Notify provider and family/EC per policy; complete incident report and update care plan/interventions. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
sections.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

sections.heading: Specimen & labs
sections.text: Collect specimens per order and protocol, label correctly, and document collection time and resident tolerance. Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Neuro checks pathway
sections.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated (head strike suspected, anticoagulants, AMS, abnormal neuro findings). Maintain infection control practices throughout.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents. Perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Communicable disease control
sections.text: Implement isolation and monitoring consistent with guidance; document symptoms, onset, and interventions. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Provider notification (SBAR)
sections.text: Use SBAR to notify the provider of significant change in condition. Include baseline comparison, objective findings, and specific request. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Fever evaluation
sections.text: Assess for onset, associated symptoms (respiratory/GU/GI/wound), vital signs, SpO2, hydration status, and mental status compared to baseline. Use facility forms/logs as required.

sections.heading: Immediate post-fall assessment
sections.text: Assess for injury, pain, ROM, neuro status, head strike, bleeding/bruising, and compare to baseline. Obtain vital signs. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Investigation & documentation
sections.text: Facilities should investigate incidents/accidents and document assessment, interventions, notifications, and follow-up actions. Escalate for red flags per protocol/provider orders.

sections.heading: Respiratory hygiene
sections.text: Encourage source control, cough etiquette, and masking during respiratory illness as indicated. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.

sections.heading: Outbreak reporting
sections.text: Notify appropriate parties per NYSDOH guidance when outbreak thresholds are met; maintain line lists as required. Ensure documentation is timely and objective.
